page.title: 17BRENDON HILL CRAFTS
page.content: The artist and his wife live in what used to be the miner's supervisors cottage and they have extended this. When they moved in three years ago it was semi converted and they have completed this but have retained the original exterior appearance. He used to be a producton engineer for Clark's shoes at Street before taking up painting full time. He paints in both water colour and oils, mostly ladscapes, some of which are for comission. He also does a number of pen and ink drawings of buildings which are used by hotels, businesses and guest houses as designs on brochures, menus and napkins. The oil paintings he sells for around Â£50, although a lot depends on the size and type of frame used.
